Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery amphoriskos; exterior: two narrow bands above black-figure decoration consisting of head (of horseman, on 1965,0930.753) and part of rear of horse, to left; large incised splinter rosette.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 63, no. A39)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 218, no. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.151) (Phase 1)
